Package Solvers

Class Solver

java.lang.Object
Solvers.Solver
Direct Known Subclasses:
RecursiveSearcher, Resolution, ResolutionReduction, Walker
public abstract class Solver extends Object
This is the superclass of all solver classes. Its static methods maintain information about all solver classes Its instance methods proved the interface to the ProblemSupervisor. Created by ohlbach on 09.10.2018.

  • Constructor Details

    • Solver

      public Solver(Integer solverNumber, HashMap<String,Object> solverParameters, ProblemSupervisor problemSupervisor)
      constructs a solver as an instance of the Processor class.
      Parameters:
      solverNumber - to distinguish different solvers of the same type, but different parameters,
      solverParameters - the control parameters for the solver
      problemSupervisor - the central processor.

  • Method Details

    • isSolver

      public static boolean isSolver(String name)
      checks if the name is a solver name
      Parameters:
      name - a string
      Returns:
      true if the name is the name of a solver.

    • solverClass

      public static Class solverClass(String solverName)
      maps the solver names to the solver classes. This method must be extended when a new solver class is added.
      Parameters:
      solverName - a solver name
      Returns:
      the solver class, or null

    • help

      public static String help()
      collects all the help-strings for all solver classes
      Returns:
      the collected help string for all solver classes

    • help

      public static String help(String solverName)
      returns the help-string for the generator with the given name
      Parameters:
      solverName - a solver name
      Returns:
      its help-string

    • parseParameters

      public static ArrayList<HashMap<String,Object>> parseParameters(String solverName, HashMap<String,String> parameters, Monitor errors, Monitor warnings)
      parses the string-type parameters into sequences of objects
      Parameters:
      solverName - the solver name
      parameters - a key-value map with parameters as strings
      errors - for collecting error messages
      warnings - for collecting warning messages
      Returns:
      a list of key-value maps where the values are objects.

    • construct

      public static Solver construct(String solverName, int solverNumber, HashMap<String,Object> solverParameters, ProblemSupervisor problemSupervisor)
      constructs a new solver of the given type
      Parameters:
      solverName - the solver name
      solverParameters - a key-value map with parameters as strings
      problemSupervisor - the central processor
      Returns:
      a new solver

    • initialize

      protected void initialize()

    • importTrueLiteral

      public Result importTrueLiteral(int literal)
      This method is called when another solver found a new true literal. It should be overwritten in the solver classes, because otherwise this important information is lost.
      Parameters:
      literal - a new true literal

    • importBinaryClause

      public void importBinaryClause(int literal1, int literal2)
      This method is called when another solver found a new binary clause. It need be overwritten in the solver class when it uses implication DAGs.
      Parameters:
      literal1 - the first literal of the clause
      literal2 - the second literal of the clause

    • importClause

      public void importClause(int[] literals)
      This method is called when another solver found a new clause. It need be overwritten in the solver class when it wants to exploit these clauses
      Parameters:
      literals - the literals of the clause

    • importEquivalence

      public void importEquivalence(int literal1, int literal2, it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntArrayList origins)
      This method is called when another solver found an equivalence p == q
      Parameters:
      literal1 - a literal
      literal2 - a literal
      origins - null or the ids of the basicClauses which imply the equivalence

    • importDisjointness

      public void importDisjointness(int predicate1, int predicate2, it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntArrayList origins)
      This method is called when another solver found a disjointness p != q
      Parameters:
      predicate1 - a predicate
      predicate2 - a predicate
      origins - null or the ids of the basicClauses which imply the disjointness

    • solve

      public abstract Result solve()
      The key method, which has to be implemented by the solvers. It is supposed to find a model or a contradiction in the clauses.
      Returns:
      Un/Satisfiable or null

    • prepare

      public abstract void prepare()

    • getStatistics

      public abstract Statistic getStatistics()

    • statusInModel

      public int statusInModel(Clause clause, Model model)
      This method checks if all literals are true or all literals are false in a model
      Parameters:
      clause - a clause
      model - a model
      Returns:
      +1 if all literals are true, -1 if all literals are false, otherwise 0.

    • trueInModel

      public boolean trueInModel(Clause clause, Model model)
      This method checks if some literals are true or all literals are false in a model
      Parameters:
      clause - a clause
      model - a model
      Returns:
      true if the clause is true in the model

    • checkModel

      public Result checkModel(Model model)
      The method checks if the model satisfies the basic clauses.
      Returns:
      null or an Erraneous Result
